solution_line_template: The vehicle's speed decreases to {base_speed} x {ascend_decrease_fraction} = <<{base_speed}*{ascend_decrease_fraction}={ascend_speed}>>{ascend_speed} miles per hour when ascending to the top of the mountain.
So, the total time Crystal will have to spend going to the top of the mountain is {ascend_distance} / {ascend_speed} = <<{ascend_distance}/{ascend_speed}={ascend_time}>>{ascend_time} hours.

And the speed of the vehicle increases by {base_speed} x {descend_increase_fraction} = <<{base_speed}*{descend_increase_fraction}={descend_speed_increase}>>{descend_speed_increase} miles per hour when going down to the foot of the mountain.
So, the total speed of the vehicle when going down is {base_speed} + {descend_speed_increase} = <<{base_speed}+{descend_speed_increase}={descend_speed}>>{descend_speed} miles per hour.
Thus, Chrystal will have to spend {descend_distance} / {descend_speed} = <<{descend_distance}/{descend_speed}={descend_time}>>{descend_time} hours to descend from the mountain.
Therefore, the total hours she will spend to pass the whole mountain is {ascend_time} + {descend_time} = <<{ascend_time}+{descend_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours.
